messages.message:
Hi thanks for making the user name more visible at the home page, there wasn't a quick way to view it previously so this helps a lot!

I feel like the positioning and weight could be a little more subtle for the username. Currently the user's name is right beside the logo, with the same font weight, and the font size larger than the nav elements. I personally felt it a little out of place and guess having it a little more subtle could work better? This will help make it not interfere with the AI Hub brand logo, and help guide user's focus to other more important elements.
We can try moving the username towards the right side with other nav options, decreasing the font size/font weight/font color so it's more subtle.  Or we can try moving it to the user profile dropdown, similar to how Google does it.
this is the organization name, not the name
i think it makes sense for the organization name, but doing this for a "personal organization" feels weird

Oh I see. Since majority for of the user's are on personal organisation, should we handle that differently?
We can try different positions for commercial organisation as well.
yeah i agree we should handle personal organizations differently
@@ yeah this is not looking good -- cc @alagu @hannah
Hmm let me look into this agree it is strange for personal org.

Starting in 23.49, we're going to support context switching, which will allow a user to switch between their personal org (their community account) and their commercial org. You can see a prototype of it here (and designs below). https://instabase.slack.com/files/U03FT35MAHF/F062YKA9770/decide_to_stay.mov

Since we received user feedback that it was not clear what org a user was working in (when in a commercial account), we wanted to start to show this to the user now to set context before we then let them start to use it to switch. The reason why we show personal org here is that this is where a user will be able to switch from their personal account to the commercial account, and also where they will see a CTA to upsell to a commercial org (if they only have their community account).
From a sizing and weight perspective, I agree it looks off - we can definitely iterate on this cc: @alagu (and @Siya once she's back in office).

@Xindi Xu based on this feedback, what we can also consider doing in the immediate term is only show this to commercial users (we can show this to community users once we have full context switching functionality).
OK, I think hiding it for community users for now makes sense :slightly_smiling_face:. I'll go update this
@Xindi Xu @hannah let’s sync for 15 - I don’t think sizing / weight looks off in the figma but think we can def improve how it looks for personal org.
Sure, we can sync on this during our design sync meeting later today
